alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 2:12PM CDT until May 26 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River at Kenton 2NE affecting Cimarron County. .Runoff from heavy rain over northeast New Mexico Wednesday will cause a significant rise on the Cimarron River in Cimarron County. For the Cimarron River...including Kenton 2NE...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River at Kenton 2NE. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Water is up to the lowest natural banks but within secondary banks. Low water crossings upstream and downstream are likely flooded. Fences below the secondary bank could sustain damage. No other known threats. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 4.2 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will rise to 4.3 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CDT.
